question_sentence: What did Chris Cuomo say after CNN suspended him over aiding his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, amid scandal?
choices: “What do you want me to do? He’s my brother.”

question_sentence: How did these packages end up in an Alabama ravine, according to authorities?
choices: The parcels were all addressed to that location.
An Amazon delivery person "wanted to send Jeff Bezos a message."
A FedEx driver dumped them there.

question_sentence: A high school shooting Tuesday left at least four students dead and others injured. In which state did the incident happen?
Who announced this week that they’re running for governor?
Which U.S. city reported the first confirmed case of the coronavirus omicron variant?
Who was placed in the NBA’s COVID-19 health and safety protocols this week?
Dr. Mehmet Oz announced he is running for a Senate seat for which state?
Chipotle announced which of these products this week?
Major League Baseball’s lockout began this week. This is its first work stoppage since:
Jack Dorsey announced that he will be leaving Twitter. Who will be replacing him as CEO?
Which island nation this week became the youngest republic in the world?
evidence: Barbados officially transitioned from a Commonwealth realm to a republic at midnight on Tuesday, at a ceremony attended by Prince Charles. The country is the first in nearly three decades to opt to remove Queen Elizabeth as head of state

question_sentence: Which high-profile journalist is set to join political magazine The New Statesman next year after quitting the BBC?
evidence: The magazine “saw off competition from bigger titles to secure Marr on an almost exclusive basis”, said Press Gazette. But he will also have sidelines presenting radio shows for LBC and Classic FM and writing a column for the LBC website

question_sentence: At what age can babies begin to develop a humour, according to new research?
evidence: Researchers at Bristol University found that the earliest reported age at which infants appeared to appreciate humour was about a month. About half of babies were reported to find things funny by the age of two months

question_sentence: Angela Merkel is handing over the German chancellorship to Olaf Scholz after holding the top job for how long?
evidence: Scholz will lead a governing coalition made up of his social democratic SPD party, the Greens and the liberal FDP following a formal handover of power next week from Merkel, a member of the centre-right CDU

question_sentence: Which government minister warned against ‘snogging under the mistletoe’ this Christmas as the Omicron variant of Covid-19 spreads across the UK?
evidence: Work and Pensions Secretary Coffey told ITV’s Peston that kissing strangers was a bad idea this festive season. But Health Secretary Sajid Javid later declared that ‘people can snog who they wish’, fuelling accusations of mixed messaging

question_sentence: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has warned that TfL may have to make which travel service cuts in order to fill a £1.9bn funding gap?
evidence: The Bakerloo line was deemed most at risk by the Daily Mail, while the London Evening Standard reported that the Jubilee, Metropolitan or Hammersmith and City lines could also be at threat

question_sentence: Telecommunications giant BT is aiming to more than double the share of its workforce from non-white backgrounds to what percentage by 2030?
evidence: BT boss Philip Jansen said that while the new diversity targets were ‘very ambitious’, his company should ‘reflect the society in which we operate’

question_sentence: The latest Christmas tree sent from Norway to adorn Trafalgar Square has failed to impress,  but why does the Nordic country give the annual gift?
choices: Because fir trees grown in the UK aren’t tall enough
In gratitude for Britain’s support during WWIII
To apologise for the Viking invasions of Britain
evidence: The city of Oslo has gifted an enormous pine tree, usually a Norwegian spruce, every year since 1947

question_sentence: What is the nickname of Ralf Rangnick, the newly appointed interim replacement for axed Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjær?
evidence: The 63-year-old German will act as manager at Old Trafford until the end of the season and will then stay on in a consultancy role for two years

question_sentence: Commons rules are to be reviewed after Labour MP Stella Creasy was recently reprimanded for doing what?
choices: Snacking on popcorn during Prime Minister’s Questions
Bringing her baby into the chamber
Referring to fellow MPs by their names during debates
evidence: Commons authorities said the Walthamstow MP breached the House’s so-called rules of behaviour and courtesies by having her three-month-old son with her as she spoke at a debate in Parliament last month

question_sentence: The US and its allies have restarted talks concerning the nuclear capabilities of which country?
evidence: After halting negations during the Trump administration, the US is looking to restart nuclear talks with Iran and re-enter the Iran nuclear agreement.

question_sentence: Which beloved American singer celebrated his last onstage performance at Radio City Music Hall in New York City at the spry age of 95?
evidence: Joined by Lady Gaga, Tony Bennett performed onstage for what will reportedly be the last time.

question_sentence: Jewish people around the world began the celebration of Hannukah this week. How many candles are typically on a Hannukah menorah?
evidence: Hannukah menorahs usually contain nine candles: eight sacred lights and one central light to light the others (sometimes, there is no central light, making eight candles). The eight sacred lights represent the eight nights that the stores of oil burned after the liberation of the sacred Temple in Jerusalem.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden recently met with CEOs from which industry to discuss challenges brought on by the holiday season?
evidence: On Cyber Monday, Biden met with the leaders of a number of retailers and grocers, including the CEOs of Best Buy, Food Lion and Walmart, to discuss how to keep items on shelves for holiday buyers.

question_sentence: Which island nation just cut its last remaining ties with the British monarchy after 400 years?
evidence: Barbados made the transition from realm to republic. The nation now no longer recognizes Queen Elizabeth as its head of state. Instead, they inaugurated their first president; former Governor-General Sandra Mason.

question_sentence: The CEO of which major tech company stepped down this week?
evidence: Jack Dorsey, cofounder and public face of Twitter, stepped down as the company’s CEO, but says he will remain part of the company’s board until at least next year.

question_sentence: What word is Merriam-Webster’s 2021 Word of the Year?
evidence: Merriam-Webster announced “vaccine” as the 2021 Word of the Year – the word selected based on lookup data, notable spikes, and year-over-year increases in searches.

question_sentence: Mark Meadows is now reportedly cooperating with the House select committee investigating the January 6th riot after initially defying a subpoena. What position did he hold during the Trump administration?
evidence: As then-President Donald Trump’s chief of staff, House investigators view Meadows as a key individual in piecing together the events of January 6th insurrection at the US Capitol.

question_sentence: The first known case of the Omicron coronavirus was just detected in the US. In what state was the case confirmed?
evidence: The first US-based case was confirmed in San Francisco, California, in a patient who had recently returned from South Africa.

question_sentence: Which professional sports league entered a work stoppage after failing to reach a new collective bargaining agreement with its players’ union?
evidence: This is the first MLB work stoppage since the infamous 1994-1995 player strike.
